snippet: The board of Detroit’s general retirement system voted Wednesday to endorse the city’s bankruptcy plan, becoming the latest retiree group to support a so-called grand bargain.
abstract: Board of Detroit's general retirement system votes to endorse city’s bankruptcy plan; becomes latest retiree group to support a so-called grand bargain that includes outside funding and base pension cuts of 4.5 percent for former municipal workers.
lead_paragraph: The board of Detroit’s general retirement system voted Wednesday to endorse the city’s bankruptcy plan, becoming the latest retiree group to support a so-called grand bargain.

headline.main: Michigan: Another Retiree Group Agrees to Pension Cuts
headline.print_headline: Michigan: Another Retiree Group Agrees to Cuts to Pensions
